1000 MILES FROM NOWHERE (Dwight Yoakam)
---------------------------------------
[I personally like to play this in G; that way you can do easier bass runs
and stuff.]


[ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]
[intro]

      [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]Am[/ch]
I'm a thousand miles from nowhere
[ch]C[/ch]                       [ch]Am[/ch]
  Time don't matter to me
             [ch]C[/ch]                       [ch]Am[/ch]
'Cause I'm a thousand miles from nowhere
             [ch]F[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]   [ch]G[/ch]
And there's no place I wanna be

I got heartaches in my pocket
I got echoes in my head
And all that I keep hearing
Are the cruel, cruel things that you said

I'm a thousand miles from nowhere
Time don't matter to me
'Cause I'm a thousand miles from nowhere
And there's no place I wanna be

   [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]F[/ch]  [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]
Oh I,  oh I,   oh I------I, I---I...

[guitar solo, same chords as verse]

Oh I...

I've got bruises on my memories
I've got tearstains on my hands
And in the mirror there's a vision
Of what used to be a man

I'm a thousand miles from nowhere

Dwight Yoakam
Dim Lights, Thick Smoke
From "3 Pears"
Tabbed by thatchadmiller (Twitter)


This is in F, but it's much easier to play in E and capo 1. I saw Dwight 
play it live and he uses a capo in E position, so there ya go!


For the guitar, play the boogie woogie blues bar chord style throughout,
and obviously use 7th's on most of this.
